result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren Terrell Nicely was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea/sentencing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:04 AM Defendant Darren T. Nicely in court by video in custody with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David S Olson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads guilty. Court finds the defendant guilty. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders sentence withheld 1 year probation consecutive to 19CF1175, 20CF528, and 20CF613. As conditions of probation defendant is to have no contact with M.J.A. or S.J.W. Must complete any assessments and recommended treatment by DOC including AODA. Must complete GED. Defendant must report to probation immediately upon release from custody. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit zero days.
Calendar call on July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Activity: Status conference
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:37 PM Defendant Darren Terrell Nicely in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video. Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Remand to branch 7 for scheduling.

Activity:  Status conference  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:04 PM Defendant Darren Terrell Nicely in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video. Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter continued to follow 21CF1213.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
